originalText.text: NYC launches $53M program to hand out pre-paid credit cards to illegal migrant families. They are stealing from us to give to them. They trashed the hotels that our government put them in. They have closed schools to give shelter to the illegal migrants. Our lives are made difficult meanwhile we work so hard to have our pay stolen and used to fund nefarious activities. NYC is not what it once was. The government is attempting to sabotage to a point of no return. It‚Äôs not too late. We can fix what this party is doing!!! Don‚Äôt lose hope!!! They want it to be so bad that the next party in office looks horrible! It won‚Äôt work!!!!

originalText.text: Governor Cuomo helped me immediately.  I have written three times to Hochul and I received no response.  I have been robbed at work, fired, blacklisted and retaliated against because I reported that my boss paid people to get into my clients‚Äô offices and steal them.  I told the CFO/President and since then I have been blacklisted throughout the country not just New York, I am also retaliated against.  The company‚Äôs counsel admits they were my clients but then realized she made a mistake refuses to speak to me. This is going on for a year.   I am tired of not being able to bu groceries and not able to buy gas. This would have been cleared off if Cuomo was still governor.  You never responded to my three notices.  Let‚Äôs see if I hear from you now.  I would like to make a living and pay my bills.  This company has prevented me from doing so.  Isn‚Äôt that a violation of my constitutional and civil rights, Ms. Governor of NY State?  Where are you when people retaliate on innocent people?  Nowhere.

originalText.text: It seems like she's a tyrant like the rest of the police in the New York City. she is not stopping the Tyranny in the NYPD. one of the easiest things she could do is stop the unlawful practice of not allowing people to film in police departments. the Supreme Court has ruled that it is 100% lawful to do so, PD policies do not trump our rights. Obviously the governor does not care, and wants the Tyranny to continue.

originalText.text: You say tax payers are paying for college in prisions,that's the least of the problem,at least they will be more educated when they go home,the problem is tax payers pay 200,000 per year per nys prisioners and basketball players invest and make money that belongs to tax payers, that's a slap in the wallet.
